授業目的:
This course provides students with insight into the nature and scope of global leadership as well as its successes, limitations and failures. Students will examine the core characteristics, behaviors, and values of what makes effective leaders in diverse global settings. This is particularly important as today’s business world is a global community.  

This course also explores organizational leadership from individual, interpersonal, gender, and cross-cultural points of view. Ultimately, students will increase awareness of oneself and have an opportunity to develop general leadership skills, gain an understanding of cross-cultural issues, develop insights into the qualities of a truly global leader, and learn how to apply the ideas personally and professionally for their future job.
到達目標:
·       Gain conceptual and theoretical understanding of effective leadership for today’s world.

·       Obtain a multi-faceted, diverse understanding of the meaning of leadership - both domestic and global.

·       Develop an increased awareness of oneself, your strengths and weaknesses in leadership roles, and the ways in which others react and respond to you.

·       Examine key issues female leaders face at work and develop strategies to overcome.

·       Define and gain the cross – cultural communication skills and competencies necessary for global inclusive leadership.
関連科目: Intercultural Communication, Intercultural Competency for Business
授業方法:
·    Utilize a wide variety of approach and experiential and interactive activities during the class and focus on student-driven exploration

·    Utilize case studies and critical incidents to provide a deeper understanding of the contents and enhance the ability to apply critical thinking

·    Work individual, pair or group on topics that relate to contents
